div.l: And good leman̄ god thee save and kepe
And with that wurd almost she gan to wepe
Aleyn roos up and thought or that it daw
I wille go crepe in be my felawe
And found the cradil with his hand anon̄
Be god coth he al wrong I haue mys gon̄
Myn̄ heed is toty of my swink to nyght
That makis me I go nought aright
I woot wel by the cradil I haue mys go
Here lithe the Milner and his wif also
And furth he goth in twenti deuel way
Into the bedde ther͗e as the Milner lay
He wend haue cropen by his felou Iohn
And by the Milner he crepis doıı̄un anon̄
And caught him by the necke and soft he spake
He seid thou Swyneshede awake
For cristis soule and here a noble game
For bi the lord that callid is seint Iame
As I haue thrice in this short nyght
Dight the Milners dought̉ir bolt upright
Whils thou hast as a coward leyn agast
Ye fals harlot coth the Milner hast
A fals traitour fals clerc quod he
Thou shalt be dede bi goddis dignite
Who durst be so bold to disparage
My dought̉ir that is comen of such linage
And by the throte bolle he caught Aleyn
And he hent him dispitousli ageyn̄
And on the nose he smote him wᵗith his fest
Doun ran̄ the blood streme on his brest
And in the floor with nose ⁊and mouth to broke
They walow fast as piggis don̄ in pook
And up they gon̄ ⁊and doun ageyn anon̄
Til that the Milner stumblid on a ston̄
And doun he fille bacward on his wif
That wist nothing of this nyce strif
For she was fal on slepe a litle wiȝt
With Iohn the clerc that wakid had al niȝt
And with the falle out of hir slepe she breid
Help̄ holi cros of bromholme she seid
In manus tuas lord to thee I calle
Awake Simond the fend is on us falle
Myn̄ hert is broke help̄ I am but dede
